background: rgb(163, 228, 255) none repeat scroll 0% 0%; -moz-user-select: none;\">MC Placeholder<br /><strong>ID: mc_4b6a...</strong></jumc></p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Is the whole article about the excitement surrounding the Summer Olympics?<br /><br />Continue reading the next two paragraphs:<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>The world loves sport so Olympic officials who approve new sports for entry into the Summer Games lineup inevitably face disappointed fans, but also happy celebrants.&nbsp; It&rsquo;s an exciting time when all fans&mdash;young or old, casual or committed&mdash;search the television for a chance to see their favorite teams in action during the two weeks of competition.&nbsp; Baseball fans like me look forward to seeing their favorite sport in the lineup.&nbsp; Instead, we sigh in resignation knowing that for two weeks we will be switching between TV channels to watch either Olympic favorites like soccer, swimming, and gymnastics or our National or American League baseball team playing at the height of that sport&rsquo;s season. &nbsp;Hope lives on, and we dream of the day when baseball and softball will be Olympic sports again, but how?<br /><br />Those in charge of approving the entry of new sports into the Summer Games lineup understand fully the importance of their selections. &nbsp;The ongoing list of proposed new sports includes traditional ones such as karate, baseball, and softball as well as those that are emerging such as surfing and skateboarding. &nbsp;It&rsquo;s an active world, and fans hope for the chance to view their favorite sports during the two-week summer competition.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Has the author introduced another topic?&nbsp; Baseball fans like me look forward to seeing their favorite sport in the lineup.&nbsp; Instead, we sigh in resignation knowing that for two weeks we will be switching between TV channels to watch either Olympic favorites like soccer, swimming, and gymnastics or our National or American League baseball team playing at the height of that sport&rsquo;s season. &nbsp;Hope lives on, and we dream of the day when baseball and softball will be Olympic sports again, but how?<br /><br />Those in charge of approving the entry of new sports into the Summer Games lineup understand fully the importance of their selections. &nbsp;The ongoing list of proposed new sports includes traditional ones such as karate, baseball, and softball as well as those that are emerging such as surfing and skateboarding. &nbsp;It&rsquo;s an active world, and fans hope for the chance to view their favorite sports during the two-week summer competition.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"What does the author think?"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"showRuler":0,"showRFB":1},"leftText":"<p>Which of the following sentences clearly states what the author thinks?</p><p><jumc ju-mc=\"mc_e7ebf6c3-a2d1-42a9-9c15-dc84dddf227a\" style=\"width: 200px;
